title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.23-24 | 13-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: It is the glorifiers, the brahmanas, who become themselves glorified by glorifying Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the Vedic culture where Brahmanas offer free service and glorify the king, and how glorifying Krishna benefits the glorifier.

segments.key_quote: The transcendental form of the lord installed in a temple is not different from the lord personally.
segments.summary: This segment explains the significance of the Archa-vigraha, the deity form of the Lord, and how it is not different from the Lord himself, being expanded by His internal potency.

segments.key_quote: Even though he appears in a material statue, actually he is not contaminated by matter.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the concept that although the Archa-vigraha appears to be made of material elements, it is completely spiritual and not contaminated by matter because the Lord is transcendental.

segments.key_quote: There is a spiritual transformation of their consciousness.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the spiritual benefits of having darshan of the Archa-incarnation, leading to a transformation of the heart and consciousness, and compares temple festivals to the festive atmosphere during the Lord's incarnation in Dvārakā.

segments.key_quote: Deity is the factual presence of the lord in his transcendental form. Idol is an imaginary form, a material form, which is imagined to be something like God.
segments.summary: This segment explains that only authorized Acharyas can install deities, inviting the Lord to reside in the Archa-vigraha, and distinguishes between a deity (factual presence of the Lord) and an idol (imaginary form).

segments.key_quote: Devotees can benefit spiritually by such worship, by such darshan.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that only devotees can understand and access the transcendental reality of the Lord, benefiting spiritually from deity worship, which results in heart transformation.
